metadata.description: Master algebra fundamentals through engaging story adventures covering variables, expressions, evaluation, and word problems.

story_theme.title: Secret Agent Training Academy
story_theme.intro: Welcome to the elite spy academy! Complete your training by mastering secret agent mathematics. Each mission will test your algebra skills.
story_theme.context: Agent, you've been recruited to join the most prestigious spy academy. To graduate, you must prove your mathematical prowess through a series of covert operations.

questions.question: Agent, we intercepted an enemy transmission: 'Meet at location n + 7'. If n represents the secret building number, what does 'n' mean in spy terms?
choices: A specific building number we know
An unknown building number we need to find
A random letter with no meaning
questions.correct_answer: An unknown building number we need to find
questions.explanation: In spy codes, letters like 'n' represent unknown values that agents need to discover through investigation!

questions.question: Your spy equipment costs x dollars, and your gadgets cost 25 dollars more than the equipment. Write an expression for the total cost of your gadgets.
questions.explanation: Since gadgets cost 25 MORE than equipment (x), the expression is x + 25. Great work, agent!

questions.question: An agent has k surveillance cameras. The headquarters gives them 12 more cameras for a mission. Which expression shows their total cameras?
questions.explanation: Adding 12 more cameras to the original k cameras gives us k + 12 total cameras. Well done, agent!

questions.question: In your spy gear, you have 5w (weapons) + 3w (more weapons) + 2s (surveillance tools) + s (another surveillance tool). Simplify your total inventory.
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: 5w + 3w = 8w, and 2s + s = 3s. Your simplified inventory is 8w + 3s.

questions.question: Your spy team's resources are: 7p + 4 + 2p - 1 + 3p, where p represents personnel units. Simplify this expression.
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: 7p + 2p + 3p = 12p, and 4 - 1 = 3. Final answer: 12p + 3.

questions.question: Agent, you have 4d (devices) and receive 3d (more devices). What's your simplified total?
questions.explanation: When combining like terms: 4d + 3d = 7d. Excellent work, recruit!

questions.question: The rocket launch sequence is t + 15 seconds, where t is the countdown timer. If the timer shows 45 seconds (t = 45), when will the rocket launch?
questions.explanation: Substitute t = 45 into the expression: 45 + 15 = 60 seconds. Mission timing confirmed!

questions.question: Your spy plane needs 3f + 8 liters of fuel, where f is the flight distance factor. For a 12-unit distance mission (f = 12), how much fuel is required?
questions.explanation: Substitute f = 12: 3(12) + 8 = 36 + 8 = 44 liters. Mission fuel calculated perfectly!

questions.question: Agent Smith is 5 years older than Agent Jones. If Agent Jones is j years old, and their combined age is 35, write an equation to find j.
questions.explanation: Agent Jones: j years, Agent Smith: j + 5 years. Combined: j + (j + 5) = 35. Great detective work!

questions.question: The treasure map shows: 'Take 4 times the secret number, then subtract 7 to get 29'. What is the secret number?
questions.explanation: Set up equation: 4n - 7 = 29. Solving: 4n = 36, so n = 9. The secret number is 9. Mission accomplished, Agent!

story_theme.title: Medieval Castle Builder
story_theme.intro: You are the royal castle architect! Design and build the most magnificent castle in the kingdom using your mathematical blueprints.
story_theme.context: The king has appointed you as the chief castle builder. You must use algebra to plan, design, and construct the perfect medieval fortress.

questions.question: The royal architect's blueprint shows 'Tower height = h + 20 feet'. What does the letter 'h' represent in castle terms?
choices: An unknown height we need to determine
questions.correct_answer: An unknown height we need to determine
questions.explanation: In architectural blueprints, 'h' represents an unknown height that must be calculated based on the castle's requirements!

questions.question: The castle wall costs w gold coins per section. Adding the moat costs 150 gold coins more than the wall. Write an expression for the total moat cost.
questions.explanation: Since the moat costs 150 MORE than the wall (w), the expression is w + 150. Excellent planning, master builder!

questions.question: A mason has s stone blocks. The quarry delivers 75 more blocks for the castle. Which expression shows the total blocks?
questions.explanation: Adding 75 more blocks to the original s blocks gives us s + 75 total blocks. Perfect calculation, architect!

questions.question: Your castle has 6c (catapults) + 2c (more catapults) + 4a (archers) + 3a (more archers). Simplify your total defense inventory.
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: 6c + 2c = 8c, and 4a + 3a = 7a. Your defense inventory is 8c + 7a.

questions.question: The castle construction requires: 9m + 12 - 3m + 8 - m, where m represents material units. Simplify this expression.
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: 9m - 3m - m = 5m, and 12 + 8 = 20. Final result: 5m + 20.

questions.question: The castle has 5r (royal rooms) and receives 4r (more royal rooms). What's the simplified total?
questions.explanation: When combining like terms: 5r + 4r = 9r. Outstanding work, royal architect!

questions.question: The foundation takes d + 30 days to complete, where d is the preparation time. If preparation takes 25 days (d = 25), how long for the foundation?
questions.explanation: Substitute d = 25 into the expression: 25 + 30 = 55 days. Construction timeline confirmed!

questions.question: The castle costs 2b + 500 gold coins, where b is the base construction factor. For a grand castle (b = 200), what's the total cost?
questions.explanation: Substitute b = 200: 2(200) + 500 = 400 + 500 = 900 gold coins. Royal budget calculated perfectly!

questions.question: Sir Arthur is 8 years older than Sir Lancelot. If Sir Lancelot is l years old, and their combined age is 42, write an equation to find l.
questions.explanation: Sir Lancelot: l years, Sir Arthur: l + 8 years. Combined: l + (l + 8) = 42. Excellent knightly mathematics!

questions.question: The dragon guards treasure and says: 'Triple my favorite number, then add 12 to get 45'. What is the dragon's favorite number?
questions.explanation: Set up equation: 3n + 12 = 45. Solving: 3n = 33, so n = 11. The dragon's favorite number is 11. Castle quest completed!

story_theme.title: Space Mission Control
story_theme.intro: Houston, we need your help! As the mission commander, use algebra to navigate spacecraft, calculate fuel, and solve cosmic challenges.
story_theme.context: You're the lead mission commander at NASA's space center. The success of our Mars expedition depends on your mathematical precision and problem-solving skills.

questions.question: Mission Control receives coordinates: 'Launch position = p + 500 meters'. What does the variable 'p' represent in space terms?
choices: A fixed position we already know
An unknown position we need to calculate
questions.correct_answer: An unknown position we need to calculate
questions.explanation: In space navigation, 'p' represents an unknown position value that mission control needs to determine for precise launch!

questions.question: The main engines use f liters of fuel. The backup thrusters use 300 liters more fuel than the main engines. Write an expression for the backup thruster fuel consumption.
questions.explanation: Since backup thrusters use 300 MORE liters than main engines (f), the expression is f + 300. Excellent space engineering!

questions.question: A spacecraft has m supply modules. Earth sends 18 additional modules for the mission. Which expression shows the total modules?
questions.explanation: Adding 18 more modules to the original m modules gives us m + 18 total modules. Perfect space logistics!

questions.question: Your space fleet has 4s (shuttles) + 3s (more shuttles) + 5r (rovers) + 2r (additional rovers). Simplify your total fleet inventory.
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: 4s + 3s = 7s, and 5r + 2r = 7r. Your space fleet is 7s + 7r.

questions.question: The mission needs: 8t + 25 - 5t + 15 + 2t, where t represents technology units. Simplify this expression.
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: 8t - 5t + 2t = 5t, and 25 + 15 = 40. Mission resources: 5t + 40.

questions.question: Mission Control has 6c (communication satellites) and launches 3c (more satellites). What's the simplified total?
questions.explanation: When combining like terms: 6c + 3c = 9c. Outstanding work, Mission Commander!

questions.question: The rocket launches in t + 180 seconds, where t is the systems check time. If systems check takes 120 seconds (t = 120), when does launch occur?
questions.explanation: Substitute t = 120 into the expression: 120 + 180 = 300 seconds. Launch sequence confirmed!

questions.question: The Mars mission requires 4v + 1200 liters of fuel, where v is the velocity factor. For maximum speed (v = 150), how much total fuel is needed?
questions.explanation: Substitute v = 150: 4(150) + 1200 = 600 + 1200 = 1800 liters. Mars mission fuel calculated perfectly!

questions.question: Commander Nova's mission is 6 months longer than Captain Stellar's mission. If Captain Stellar's mission is s months, and their combined mission time is 18 months, write an equation to find s.
questions.explanation: Captain Stellar: s months, Commander Nova: s + 6 months. Combined: s + (s + 6) = 18. Excellent mission mathematics!

questions.question: The friendly aliens present a math puzzle: 'Take 5 times our planet's magic number, then subtract 8 to get 37'. What is their planet's magic number?
questions.explanation: Set up equation: 5n - 8 = 37. Solving: 5n = 45, so n = 9. The alien planet's magic number is 9. Cosmic mission accomplished!
